author: The Telegraph
title: A Disney holiday for all seasons
text: Every moment is special on a Disney holiday , but if you’re looking for a way to up the ante, there is no shortage of spectacular special events throughout the year, making the most magical holidays ever yet more magical. From November, the Magic Kingdom comes alive with its annual yuletide event, Mickey’s Very Merry Christmas Party. On special ticketed evenings, an awe-inspiring holiday party takes place once the park has closed to the public. Christmas lights shimmer on Cinderella Castle, snow begins to fall in Main Street and festive music fills the air. Families will delight in seeing Mickey and friends in their favourite festive outfits at Mickey's Once Upon a Christmastime Parade, when an amazing array of gingerbread men, elves and snowmen culminate in a visit from Santa himself. Hallowe’en is a special time of year to visit, with Mickey’s Not-So-Scary Hallowe’en Party Or join Queen Elsa for A Frozen Holiday Wish, a special show on the Castle Forecourt Stage, which ends with Elsa transforming Cinderella’s Castle into a glimmering ice palace. Epcot stages its own Christmas spectacle with its candlelit processional, shown up to three times daily on special dates throughout November and December. Celebrity narrators tell the Christmas story with the help of a 50-piece orchestra and choir, creating a special event the whole family can savour. In springtime the Disney parks bloom into life with festivals such as Epcot International Flower & Garden Festival (March-May), which brings colourful topiary displays of Disney characters and plenty of family-friendly entertainment to inspire the next generation of the green-fingered, from outdoor kitchens to interactive play areas for children. Flower power: Epcot International Flower and Garden Festival Epcot celebrates the world’s exciting culinary scene from September to November with the Food and Wine Festival. Foodies can sample dishes from more than 30 different destinations in the special “global marketplace”. Learn to pair regional dishes with their perfect wine accompaniments and discover impeccable menus accompanied by great entertainment at special tasting events. Hallowe’en is a particularly special time of year to visit Walt Disney World, with Mickey’s Not-So-Scary Hallowe’en Party coming to the Magic Kingdom Park every autumn. Eerie entertainment amuses little kids, and trick- or-treating for all means that the whole family can join in the fun. And the children will love seeing their favourite Disney characters dressed up in their finest Hallowe’en ensembles. Encounter your favourite Disney characters in their festive attire The magic continues on board Disney’s ships, where every event is an excuse for a special party. Enjoy a spooky experience at sea for Hallowe’en, with ghoulish games and trick-or-treating at Mickey’s Mouse-querade Party in the atrium. Kids clubs for teens and tweens offer pumpkin-carving and mask-making, and there is a special interactive movie experience featuring Tim Burton’s The Nightmare Before Christmas. Do not miss spooky storytelling on the deck, or the costume party especially for adults. Then throughout November until Christmas you can enjoy festive fun on a Very Merry Times Cruise on Disney Magic, Fantasy, Dream or Wonder and experience a twist on holiday traditions that is sure to delight the whole family. Witness the shimmering splendour of fairy lights around the ships as well as the colourful Christmas garlands and red poinsettias that deck the halls. Santa at sea: kids can meet Santa Claus on Disney cruises at Christmastime Kids big and small will be blown away by the fairytale festivities of the life-sized edible gingerbread house and the 24ft-tall Christmas tree, which children can help illuminate in the tree-lighting ceremony. Holiday cheer continues with Santa Claus meet-and-greets and the chance to encounter your favourite Disney characters decked out in their festive attire. Themed crafts for little ones and holiday parties for tweens mean the kids will be calling this their favourite Christmas for years to come. Join in the fun at the Deck the Deck tropical holiday party, featuring candy-cane limbo and lots of fun for all, and on Christmas Eve cookies, gifts and special festive towel animals will magically appear in your stateroom for a thoughtful seasonal surprise. Whether you are celebrating on land or at sea, you can be sure of a generous sprinkling of Disney magic to ensure a special experience for the whole family. • Find out more about Disney Cruises, Disney holidays and Walt Disney World
